creator: caster@gentoo.org
text:
I discovered this when trying to bump the Gentoo package of Ant, since we pass sourcepath="" to <javac> in ant's build.xml to catch inter-jar dependencies:

build-core:
Compiling 564 source files to /var/tmp/portage/dev-java/ant-core-1.8.1/work/apache-ant-1.8.1/build/classes
/var/tmp/portage/dev-java/ant-core-1.8.1/work/apache-ant-1.8.1/src/main/org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/XSLTProcess.java:674: package org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional does not exist
            liaison = new org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.TraXLiaison();

If you are not so strict, it builds but there is a hidden dependency on ant-nodeps.jar in ant.jar. Which I assume is not entirely correct?
Looks like when TraXLiaison was in ant-trax.jar, it was loaded dynamically from XSLTProcess.

creator: jglick@apache.org
text: TraXLiaison ought to be in ant.jar, not ant-nodeps.jar, I guess; not sure what exactly the difference is supposed to be.

creator: caster@gentoo.org
text:
Thanks for the quick patch.
Tried it, however TraXLiaison depends on XSLTTraceSupport.

So I added also this line to the patch:

<not><filename name="${optional.package}/XSLTTraceSupport*"/></not>

With this it works.

BTW wouldn't it be cleaner to move the files from the optional package? Of course I don't know all the possible implications of this...

creator: jglick@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> <not><filename name="${optional.package}/XSLTTraceSupport*"/></not>

OK, please test revision 946700.

> wouldn't it be cleaner to move the files from the optional package?

Perhaps, but since everything in Ant is public, there is no way to know what might be broken by that.
